00011 #define HEAP_SHRINK_SIZE_MINIMUM 0x16000
00012 
00017 void initializeHeap(heap_t * heap, uint32 address)
00018 {
00019         //Double check the heap ptr is valid
00020         if (heap == 0) return;
00021 
00022         DEBUG_PRINT("Debug Message: Creating Heap\n");
00023         memset(heap, 0, sizeof(heap_t));
00024         DEBUG_PRINT("Debug Message: 0'ed Heap\n");
00025 
00026         //Set the heap location to the specified address
00027         heap->heap_location = address & PAGE_MASK; //Page aligned boundry
00028         DEBUG_PRINT("Debug Message: Heap Location ");
00029         DEBUG_PRINTX(heap->heap_location);
00030         DEBUG_PRINT("\n");
00031 
00032         uint32 frame_addr = 0;
00033 
00034         frame_addr = 0;
00035 
00036         frame_addr = allocateFrame();
00037 
00038         DEBUG_PRINT("Debug Message: Allocated frame ");
00039         DEBUG_PRINTX(frame_addr);
00040         DEBUG_PRINT("\n");
00041 
00042         map(heap->heap_location, frame_addr, PAGE_PRESENT | PAGE_USER);
00043 
00044         DEBUG_PRINT("Debug Message: Mapped Heap\n");
00045 
00046         memset(heap->heap_location, 0, PAGE_SIZE);
00047         DEBUG_PRINT("Debug Message: 0'ed HEAP\n");
00048 
00049         heap_entry_t * ptr = (heap_entry_t *) heap->heap_location;
00050         memset(ptr, 0, sizeof(heap_entry_t)); //Initialize it.
00051         DEBUG_PRINT("Debug Message: Created first heap entry\n");
00052 
00053         ptr->used = 0; //Not used
00054         ptr->size = PAGE_SIZE - sizeof(heap_entry_t); //One frame has been allocated. 4096 bytes of heap space at the minute. The heap entrys are also in the space so we need to take into account for them
00055 
00056         DEBUG_PRINT("Debug Message: Set ptr size\n");
00057 
00058         ptr->next = 0; //ptr->next = NULL, this tells the heap that this is the last entry on the heap.
00059         ptr->prev = 0;
00060         DEBUG_PRINT("Debug Message: Ptr->next set\n");
00061 }
00062 
00068 void shrinkHeap(heap_t* heap, heap_entry_t* last_entry)
00069 {
00070 
00071         //Calculate the end position and the start position of the memory block
00072         MEM_LOC startOfEntry = last_entry;
00073         startOfEntry += sizeof(heap_entry_t);
00074 
00075         MEM_LOC endOfEntry = startOfEntry;
00076         endOfEntry += last_entry->size;
00077 
00078         if (endOfEntry > heap + HEAP_SHRINK_SIZE_MINIMUM)
00079         {
00080                 //XOR The (PAGE_SIZE - 1) will give the nearest page aligned boundry less than endOfEntry
00081                 MEM_LOC nearestPageBoundry = endOfEntry;
00082                 nearestPageBoundry = nearestPageBoundry & (~0xFFF);
00083 
00084                 if (nearestPageBoundry < endOfEntry)
00085                 {
00086                         if (nearestPageBoundry > startOfEntry + 1)
00087                         {
00088 
00089                                 //TODO: Investigate whether -1 is needed?
00090                                 //Set the blocks size to newSize
00091                                 size_t newSize = nearestPageBoundry - startOfEntry;
00092                                 last_entry->size = newSize;
00093 
00094                                 //Find out what location (Frame) this area is mapped to
00095                                 MEM_LOC mappingData = 0;
00096                                 getMapping(nearestPageBoundry, &mappingData);
00097 
00098                                 //Free that frame of memory
00099                                 freeFrame(mappingData);
00100 
00101                                 //Unmap it from the heap
00102                                 unmap(mappingData);
00103 
00104                                 shrinkHeap(heap, last_entry);
00105                         }
00106                 }
00107 
00108         }
00109 }
00110 
00114 void expandHeap(heap_t* heap, heap_entry_t* last_entry)
00115 {
00116         //Map another 4kb onto the heap
00117         //This is the last entry on the heap SO if its not used we can just += the size otherwise we have to create a whole new one (More work for mee)
00118 
00119         MEM_LOC frame_addr = allocateFrame();
00120         MEM_LOC end = last_entry;
00121         end += sizeof(heap_entry_t);
00122         end += last_entry->size;
00123 
00124         map(end, frame_addr, PAGE_PRESENT | PAGE_USER); //Mapped now! =)
00125 
00126         memset(end, 0, PAGE_SIZE);
00127                         
00128         if (last_entry->used == 0) 
00129         {
00130                 last_entry->size += PAGE_SIZE;
00131         } 
00132         else 
00133         {
00134                 //Create a new entry at end and link it to the heap
00135                 heap_entry_t * nptr = (heap_entry_t *) end;
00136                 nptr->used = 0;
00137                 nptr->size = PAGE_SIZE - sizeof(heap_entry_t); //- the size of the new heap entry
00138                 nptr->prev = last_entry;
00139                 nptr->next = 0;
00140                 last_entry->next = nptr;
00141         }
00142 
00143 }

00149 uint32 heapAllocateMemory(uint32 size, heap_t* heap) 
00150 {
00151         heap_entry_t* ptr = (heap_entry_t*) heap->heap_location;
00152         uint8 result = 0;
00153 
00154         while (1) 
00155         {
00156 
00157                 if (ptr->used == 0) //Is the chunk in use?
00158                 { 
00159                         if (ptr->size > size) //Is it big enough!?!
00160                         { 
00161                                 ptr->used = 1; //Yay it fits!
00162                                 
00163                                 if (ptr->size < size + (sizeof(heap_entry_t))) 
00164                                 { //If another chunk of memory wont fit then just allocate a few more bytes then asked for (Avoid leak)
00165                                         //Don't actually need to do anything. The next ptr is still the next pointer
00166                                 } 
00167                                 else 
00168                                 {
00169                                         heap_entry_t* newptr = (heap_entry_t*) (((uint32) ptr) + sizeof(heap_entry_t) + size);
00170                                         newptr->used = 0;
00171                                         newptr->size = ptr->size - size - sizeof(heap_entry_t);
00172                                         newptr->next = ptr->next;
00173                                         newptr->prev = ptr;
00174                                         ptr->next = newptr;
00175                                         ptr->size = size;
00176                                 }
00177 
00178                                 return ((uint32) ptr) + sizeof(heap_entry_t); //Return the location of the actual memory not the header
00179                         }
00180                 }
00181 
00182                 if (ptr->next == 0) 
00183                 {
00184                         expandHeap(heap, ptr);
00185                         return heapAllocateMemory(size, heap);
00186                 }
00187 
00188                 ptr = (heap_entry_t *) ptr->next; //Move onto the next chunk
00189         }
00190 
00191         return 0;
00192 }

00199 void heapFreeMemory(uint32 address, heap_t* heap)
00200 {
00201         heap_entry_t* ptr = (heap_entry_t*) (address - sizeof(heap_entry_t));
00202         heap_entry_t* optr = 0;
00203 
00204         if (ptr->used == 0) //If this happens then somethings gone wrong. Wtf moment much?
00205         {
00206                 return;
00207         }
00208 
00209         ptr->used = 0;
00210 
00211         while (1)
00212         {
00213                 //UNIFY Left
00214                 optr = ptr->prev;
00215                 if (optr != 0) 
00216                 {
00217                         if (optr->used == 0) //Can be unified!
00218                         { 
00219                                 optr->size = optr->size + sizeof(heap_entry_t) + ptr->size;
00220                                 optr->next = ptr->next;
00221                                 ptr = optr;
00222                         }
00223                         else
00224                         {
00225                                 break;
00226                         }
00227                 } 
00228                 else 
00229                 {
00230                         break;
00231                 }
00232         }
00233 
00234         while (1) 
00235         {
00236                 //UNIFY Right
00237                 optr = ptr->next;
00238                 if (optr != 0) 
00239                 {
00240                         if (optr->used == 0) //Can be unified!
00241                         { 
00242                                 ptr->size = ptr->size + sizeof(heap_entry_t) + optr->size;
00243                                 ptr->next = optr->next;
00244                         } 
00245                         else 
00246                         { 
00247                                 break; 
00248                         }
00249                 } 
00250                 else 
00251                 { 
00252                         break; 
00253                 }
00254         }
00255 
00256         //Check if this is the last entry
00257         if (ptr->next == 0) 
00258         {
00259                 shrinkHeap(heap, ptr);
00260         }
00261 }
